articles.description: Sir Cameron Mackintosh says the industry can't plan for a return until social distancing is "gone".
articles.content:
Image copyrightGetty ImagesImage caption
 Sir Cameron said the safety of actors and audiences was the most important thing
Theatre producer Sir Cameron Mackintosh has said that West End and Broadway theatres are unlikely to be able to stage musicals until e… [+1793 chars]

articles.title: The Apprentice star Lottie Lion apologises after Lord Sugar 'racist' comments - Mirror Online
articles.description: Controversial Lottie, who made waves on the last series of The Apprentice when she was accused of making racist comments, issued an apology after impersonating a fellow contestant
articles.content:
The Apprentice has had its fair share of big personalities, but you'd be hard pressed to find one who could outmatch the controversial Lottie Lion.
Lottie, who's only 20 years old, made her mark among last year's contenders and had accusations of racism leve… [+2374 chars]

articles.title: Laura Whitmore opens up on buying two homes before 35 as she confirms engagement - Mirror Online
articles.description: Love Island's Laura and Iain first started dating back in 2017 and now it seems they are preparing for a wedding after opening up about her life in an interview
articles.content:
Laura Whitmore seems to have finally confirmed she and long-term love Ian Stirling are engaged.
 The 34-year-old, who took over from tragic friend Caroline Flack as Love Island host, gave the nod to an article saying the pair are taking the next step.

articles.title: Molly Mae Hague and Tommy Fury pranked into thinking they landed a James Corden interview - Mirror Online
articles.description: After putting Katie Hopkins in her place by flying her to Prague to collect a made-up award, Josh Pieters returned by pretending James Corden was talking to the Love Island stars on the Late Late Show
articles.content:
Molly Mae Hague and Tommy Fury are the latest stars to fall victim to notorious celebrity prankster Josh Pieters.
He made the oblivious Love Island finalists think they were being interviewed by James Corden on the Late Late Show.
Clips of the US favourite … [+1929 chars]

articles.title: Tony Allen obituary - The Guardian
articles.description: Masterful drummer and co-creator of Afrobeat, the fusion of funk, jazz and African styles that he pioneered with Fela Kuti
articles.content: On 12 and 13 March there were two concerts in the Church of Sound series at St James the Great Church in Clapton, east London. They were staged in the round, with both the audience and the small band of brass, keyboards and guitar circled around the star play… [+6891 chars]

articles.title: Meghan Markle 'to ignore royal tradition and embrace American trend' on Archie's 1st birthday - Entertainment Daily
articles.description: A royal expert is predicting a very American birthday for baby Archie
articles.content:
A royal expert is predicting that Meghan Markle will snub royal birthday traditions on baby Archie's first birthday.
Meghan, 38, and Prince Harry, 35, are just days away from celebrating their son's birthday on May 6.

articles.title: Real reason why Diana ‘lacked discipline Royal Family expected from her’ revealed - Express
articles.description: PRINCESS DIANA is often recognised as the royal rebel, and an unearthed biography has revealed a potential reason why she 'lacked the discipline' the monarchy expects from all those within the royal fold.
